page.title: 01BRADFIELD AREA.
page.content: The area around Bradfield is one of great natural beauty.The village itself is divided into two parts-High and Low Bradfield.As the name suggests High Bradfield is situated at the top of the hill and Low Bradfield lies in the valley at the bottom.The houses are nearly all of stone mellowed by age with just a few new ones which in time will blend in with the old.It is hilly rather than mountainous country lying at the edge of the Peak National Park.There are many coniferous woods bordering the reservoirs but not many decidous trees.Much of the land is moorland covered with heather & bracken.This is also farming country; the higher ground providing grazing land for sheep farmers & the lower used by a few farmers as pasture land for their dairy cattle.
